Description: Leather shoe swayed for the left foot. The sole consists of one layer. The upper, also made of one layer, has a red edge binding, which is at the back included in the back seam. The binding forms, together with a second binding, the clover-shaped protruding decorative element at the front of the instep. The sole/upper construction includes a rand and is sewned with interlocking running stitching. There is a semi-circular reinforcement patch at the heel. The shoe is further enhanced with an applied, heart-shaped decorative patch. The appliqué is flanked with sewn motifs (Xs, diamonds and stars).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: John de Monins Johnson
Dimensions: Length: 105 millimetres (upper front (incl. decorative clover al instep))
Curator's comments: Cf. EA 53918. (of comparable construction as described for EA 53919, 53920 and 53921, but with additional, decorative X-stitches)
Bibliographic references: O'Connell et al 2014 / Antinoupolis at the British Museum (22)
